Class Village

java.lang.Object
Room
Village
public class Village extends Room
ASCIIADVENTURER Caden Finley Albert Tucker Grijesh Shrestha The Village class represents the village area in the game. It extends the Room class and includes additional properties and methods specific to the village area.
Version:
1.0
Author:
ASCIIADVENTURERS

    church()
    The function `church()` in Java simulates a player interacting with a priest in a village church, allowing them to give or leave a heart container for blessings and strength enhancements.

    The `hotel` function allows the player to rest and regain health at a cost in a text-based game, with options to either rest or leave the hotel.

    The shop1 function in Java allows players to buy items with gold, displaying a message with bold and bright text options.

    startRoom()
    The startRoom function in Java sets the player in a village environment with * various options to interact with different locations and warp to other areas based on completed dungeons.
